intro: Spartium patens proles procerum, commonly known as the slender spartium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. The seeds are enclosed in pods, which split open to release the seeds when mature.
